review: 8 years later and still one of MARVEL’s best teaser trailers.

Crazy how the line “he is a friend from work” came from a make-a-wish kid that was visiting the set while they were shooting the movie. The kid said “you should say he is a friend from work when you see him” and boom. Its in the movie. Crazy.

Man this still holds up even after watching the movie.
It’s well intentioned but ultimately numbing, an instance of fun overkill whose ultimate goal seems to be to put us into a special-effects coma. Not even the occasional inspired touch can save it.
It certainly coordinated things well to leave impressions. The trailer takes careful pains to underline just how impossible it will be to stop Hela by normal superhero methods.

Thor throws Mjolnir and Hela just catches it headfirst. As "The Immigrant Song"'s intro ramps up the tension, she makes a pants-wetting display of power by calmly, slowly gripping her bare fingers around the Uru relic tight enough to shatter it; her face never tenses or even changes expression from that bemused smirk. At the moment the magic contained within explodes outward, the real melody and action starts.
Honestly, the teaser was better than the trailer.
yeah a lot of things in the trailer didn't actually happened in the movie.
